title: Beginners Guide to KDP Keyword Research

tactics.name: Amazon Search Suggestions
tactics.description: Use Amazon's search bar suggestions and a free chrome plugin to identify high-traffic keywords customers are actively searching for.
steps: Start with broad search terms on Amazon.com
Capture search suggestions and plugin-generated keywords
Organize keywords in a spreadsheet with search result counts
caveats: High competition keywords (e.g., 40,000+ results) should be avoided
source_quotes: 'Amazon is actually telling us what customers are searching for.'

tactics.name: target_low_competition_keywords
tactics.description: Focus on keywords with 1000 search results or less to increase ranking chances
steps: Use spreadsheet to compile keyword suggestions from AMZ Suggestion Expander
Stop adding new suggestions when duplicates appear
Match keywords to Amazon search results
caveats: Books may still fail to rank despite keyword selection
source_quotes: I target keywords with 1000 search results or less because I've found after publishing nearly two and a half thousand books, if I do that, there's a good chance that my book will rank on the first page for that particular search term.

heuristics.name: Competition Filter
heuristics.condition: If search results exceed 50,000, prioritize alternative keywords

heuristics.name: boost_low_review_keywords
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are less than 200, prioritize keywords
source_quotes: those less competitive keywords won't be searched for as often, therefore it's not going to make as many sales

claims.statement: Books on the first page of Amazon search results generate significantly more sales.
source_quotes: 'The higher up on that first page, the better, the more sales your book is going to make.'

claims.statement: Targeting keywords with 1000 search results or less increases ranking chances
source_quotes: I target keywords with 1000 search results or less because I've found after publishing nearly two and a half thousand books, if I do that, there's a good chance that my book will rank on the first page for that particular search term.

niche_patterns.description: Target specific audience needs with niche constraints to reduce competition
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Combines broad search terms with targeted qualifiers to capture underserved markets
source_quotes: 'Customers will tend to click on these suggestions.'
